H0.text: Igneous is the type of rock in which the fossil imprint of a fern leaf is most likely to be found.

H1.text: Metamorphic rock is the type of rock in which a fossil imprint of a fern leaf is most likely to be found.

H2.text: Sedimentary rock is the type of rock in which the fossil imprint of a fern leaf is most likely to be found.

H3.text: Volcanic rock is the type of rock in which the fossil imprint of a fern leaf is most likely to be found.

A4.text: Among the three major types of rock, fossils are most commonly found in sedimentary rock.

A5.text: Unlike most igneous and metamorphic rocks, sedimentary rocks form at temperatures and pressures that do not destroy fossil remains.
